filmography.title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
filmography.role_description: A young Athenian woman caught in a magical romantic quadrangle in the forest; de Havilland's film debut.
filmography.plot: Shakespeare's comedy about four young lovers and a troupe of amateur actors who are manipulated by fairies in a magical forest.

filmography.title: Captain Blood
filmography.role_description: The spirited niece of a plantation owner who buys a doctor-turned-slave, marking the first of eight collaborations with Errol Flynn.
filmography.plot: A doctor wrongly sentenced to slavery in the Caribbean becomes a notorious pirate to strike back against the injustices of the King.

filmography.title: The Charge of the Light Brigade
filmography.role_description: A woman caught in a love triangle between two brothers who are British officers in India.
filmography.plot: A British major betrays his regiment and his brother by romancing his brother's fiancée, leading to the infamous charge during the Crimean War.

filmography.title: It's Love I'm After
filmography.role_description: A young socialite infatuated with a stage actor, whose fiancée tries to break the obsession by acting boorish.
filmography.plot: A stage couple's relationship is tested when a young fan falls in love with the actor, leading to a scheme to disenchant her.

filmography.title: The Adventures of Robin Hood
filmography.role_description: The noble ward of King Richard who discovers the truth about the oppression of the poor and falls for the outlaw Robin Hood.
filmography.plot: When Prince John begins oppressing the Saxon commoners, a Saxon lord fights back as the outlaw leader of a rebel guerrilla army.

filmography.title: Dodge City
filmography.role_description: A woman who moves West and initially clashes with the new town sheriff before falling in love with him.
filmography.plot: A cattle agent in Kansas accepts the job of sheriff in Dodge City to clean up the lawless town.

filmography.title: The Private Lives of Elizabeth and Essex
filmography.role_description: A lady-in-waiting to Queen Elizabeth I who loves the Earl of Essex, sparking the Queen's jealousy.
filmography.plot: A dramatization of the volatile relationship between the aging Queen Elizabeth I and the ambitious Earl of Essex.

filmography.title: Gone with the Wind
filmography.role_description: The sweet, selfless, and resilient cousin of Scarlett O'Hara who serves as the moral center of the story.
filmography.plot: A manipulative woman and a roguish man conduct a turbulent romance during the American Civil War and Reconstruction periods.

filmography.title: Santa Fe Trail
filmography.role_description: A spirited woman caught in a romantic rivalry between soldiers Jeb Stuart and George Custer leading up to the Civil War.
filmography.plot: Jeb Stuart and George Custer battle the abolitionist John Brown while competing for the hand of the same woman.

filmography.title: The Strawberry Blonde
filmography.role_description: An outspoken suffragette and nurse who marries a dentist and proves to be the 'right girl' over her glamorous rival.
filmography.plot: A man feels he married the wrong girl and envies his old rival, but eventually realizes he is the lucky one.

filmography.title: Hold Back the Dawn
filmography.role_description: A naive American schoolteacher in Mexico who is romanced by a European gigolo seeking entry into the US.
filmography.plot: A European refugee marries an American schoolteacher in Mexico to get a visa, but finds himself falling in love with her.

filmography.title: They Died with Their Boots On
filmography.role_description: The devoted wife of General George Custer who supports him through his military career and final battle.
filmography.plot: A fictionalized account of the life of General George Custer, from his days at West Point to his death at the Little Bighorn.

filmography.title: The Male Animal
filmography.role_description: The wife of a mild-mannered professor who considers leaving him for a former football star during a weekend of chaos.
filmography.plot: A college professor's life is complicated by the return of his wife's former football star boyfriend and a debate over academic freedom.

filmography.title: In This Our Life
filmography.role_description: The good-natured sister whose husband is stolen by her selfish, neurotic sister, played by Bette Davis.
filmography.plot: A neurotic woman ruins her sister's life by running off with her husband and then tries to pin a hit-and-run accident on a young black man.

filmography.title: Princess O'Rourke
filmography.role_description: A European princess visiting the US who falls in love with an American pilot after taking a sleeping pill and forgetting her identity.
filmography.plot: A princess in exile in New York City falls for a pilot who doesn't know she is royalty.

filmography.title: To Each His Own
filmography.role_description: An unwed mother who gives up her son to avoid scandal and watches him grow up from afar, aging from a young girl to a middle-aged woman.
filmography.plot: A middle-aged woman reflects on her life as an unwed mother in London during World War I and World War II.

filmography.title: The Dark Mirror
filmography.role_description: A dual role playing twin sisters—one sweet and innocent, the other psychotic and murderous—involved in a murder investigation.
filmography.plot: A doctor and a detective try to determine which of two identical twin sisters committed a murder.

filmography.title: The Snake Pit
filmography.role_description: A woman suffering from schizophrenia who is institutionalized in a harrowing mental asylum and struggles to recover.
filmography.plot: A woman finds herself in an insane asylum and cannot remember how she got there, leading to a journey through her subconscious.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Actress; Venice Film Festival: Win – Volpi Cup

filmography.title: The Heiress
filmography.role_description: A shy, plain heiress who is courted by a handsome fortune hunter and dominated by her cruel father, ultimately growing into a cold, hardened woman.
filmography.plot: A young woman falls for a handsome young man who her emotionally abusive father suspects is a fortune hunter.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Actress; Golden Globe: Win – Best Actress

filmography.title: My Cousin Rachel
filmography.role_description: A mysterious widow suspected of poisoning her husband, who charms her late husband's heir despite his suspicions.
filmography.plot: A young Englishman plots revenge against his late cousin's mysterious and beautiful widow, believing she murdered him.

filmography.title: Not as a Stranger
filmography.role_description: A Swedish nurse who marries an ambitious medical student to pay his tuition, enduring his neglect and infidelity.
filmography.plot: A medical student marries an older woman to pay his tuition, but his arrogance alienates those around him.
filmography.awards: National Board of Review: Top Ten Films

filmography.title: The Ambassador's Daughter
filmography.role_description: The daughter of the US Ambassador to France who dates a GI to prove that soldiers are well-behaved.
filmography.plot: A senator goes to Paris to investigate the conduct of American soldiers, and the ambassador's daughter decides to test the troops herself.

filmography.title: The Proud Rebel
filmography.role_description: A tough farm woman who helps a Confederate veteran and his mute son fight off a ruthless landowner.
filmography.plot: A Confederate veteran seeks a doctor who can cure his son's muteness, finding work on a farm owned by a woman fighting to keep her land.

filmography.title: Light in the Piazza
filmography.role_description: An American mother traveling in Italy with her mentally disabled daughter, facing a dilemma when a young Italian falls in love with the girl.
filmography.plot: An American woman tries to protect her mentally disabled daughter from the advances of a young Italian man during a vacation in Florence.

filmography.title: Lady in a Cage
filmography.role_description: A wealthy invalid trapped in a home elevator during a power outage who is terrorized by a group of intruders.
filmography.plot: A wealthy woman is trapped in a home elevator and terrorized by a group of hoodlums who invade her house.

filmography.title: Hush...Hush, Sweet Charlotte
filmography.role_description: The seemingly sweet but scheming cousin of a reclusive spinster who plots to drive her mad and steal her fortune.
filmography.plot: An aging, reclusive Southern belle plagued by a horrifying family secret descends into madness when her cousin arrives to save the family estate.

filmography.title: The Adventurers
filmography.role_description: A wealthy American socialite who becomes involved with a South American playboy and revolutionary.
filmography.plot: The son of a murdered South American diplomat discovers his father's killers and leads a revolution.

filmography.title: Airport '77
filmography.role_description: A wealthy passenger carrying valuable art on a luxury 747 that crashes into the Bermuda Triangle.
filmography.plot: A private 747 carrying VIPs and art treasures is hijacked and crashes into the ocean, trapping the survivors underwater.

filmography.title: The Fifth Musketeer
filmography.role_description: The Queen Mother of France in this adaptation of 'The Man in the Iron Mask'; de Havilland's final feature film.
filmography.plot: Louis XIV's twin brother is released from prison and learns his true identity, planning to replace the King.
